com.agilent.labs.hyperedge
Interface HyperEdge

All Superinterfaces:
Identifiable, Matchable
All Known Implementing Classes:
HyperEdgeImpl
public interface HyperEdge
extends Identifiable, Matchable

An Edge that can connect two or more Nodes. A HyperEdge consists of a set of Edges and a special Node referred to as a ConnectorNode. The ConnectorNode is a generated Node that serves as one endpoint for all Edges contained by a HyperEdge. Assumptions:

  1. HyperEdges are mutable.

  2. A HyperEdge may have more than one Node with the same Edge interaction type.

  3. A HyperEdge may have more than one Edge to the same Node.

  4. A HyperEdge has exactly one ConnectorNode.

  5. A HyperEdge ConnectorNode may be used as a regular Node within another HyperEdge.

  6. A HyperEdge is associated with exactly one GraphPerspective.

  7. The only shared Edges in a HyperEdge are those connecting two ConnectorNodes (HyperEdges) that must exist in the same GraphPerpective.

  8. A regular Cytoscape Edge may directly connect to a HyperEdge ConnectorNode, but it will not be considered part of the HyperEdge.

GraphPerspectives

A HyperEdge must belong to one or more GraphPerspectives. Within each GraphPerspective, the HyperEdge may have a different number of Edges and Nodes. Operations, such as adding or removing edges, targeted for one GraphPerspective don't affect the HyperEdge in other GraphPerspectives. The purpose of this behavior is to copy the behavior of Nodes and Edges in Cytoscape, where if an Edge exists in two or more GraphPerspectives, deleting the Edge in one GraphPerpsective does not remove the Edge in another GraphPerspective. Thus, if a HyperEdge he1, with 3 Edges, belongs to GraphPerspectives gp1 and gp2 and the following operations are performed: 
    he1.addEdge (extraEdge,gp1);
    he1.removeEdge (existingEdge,gp2);
Then he1 will contain 4 Edges in gp1 and 2 edges in gp2.

Persistence

There are no specific API operations for saving and restoring HyperEdges. However, we wish to ensure that a reference implementation can be constructed that allows transparent saving and restoring of HyperEdges using the standard Cytoscape save and restore operations.

Attributes

HyperEdges do not currently have their own attributes, however the ConnectorNode can be used to house attributes for the entire HyperEdge.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Michael L. Creech

Method Detail

addToGraphPerspective

boolean addToGraphPerspective(giny.model.GraphPerspective sourceNet,
                              giny.model.GraphPerspective targetNet)
Add this HyperEdge to a given GraphPerpsective. All Nodes and Edges contained within this HyperEdge that belong to a source GraphPerpsective are added to the target GraphPerpsective.

Parameters:
sourceNet - the source GraphPerspective from which to derive all needed Nodes and Edges (that must also belong to this HyperEdge) to add to targetNet.
targetNet - the target GraphPerspective that will modified to contain the Nodes and Edges in sourceNet that also belong this HyperEdge.
Returns:
true if this HyperEdge was successfully added to targetNet. false if this HyperEdge doesn't belong to sourceNet, or aleady belongs to targetNet.

If this HyperEdge is successfully added to targetNet, all HyperEdgeManager ChangeListeners are notified by invoking each listener's objectChanged() method with an EventNote of type HYPEREDGE, sub-type=ADDED and a supporting information object being targetNet.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if sourceNet or targetNet are null.

removeFromGraphPerspective

boolean removeFromGraphPerspective(giny.model.GraphPerspective gp)
Remove this HyperEdge from a given GraphPerspective. The Edges of this HyperEdge will be removed from this GraphPerspective. Nodes are never removed, since it is difficult to tell if the Nodes existed prior to the creation of the HyperEdge. This HyperEdges connector node is not removed, but its HyperEdge based attributes will be removed.

Parameters:
gp - the GraphPerspective from which to remove this HyperEdge. If null, will remove this HyperEdge from all GraphPerspectives for which this HyperEdge belongs (equivalent to destroy()).
Returns:
true if this HyperEdge was removed from gp. false if this HyperEdge was not a member of gp.

Before this HyperEdge is successfully removed from gp, one of two event notifications are fired:

  1. If gp=null, or gp is the last GraphPerspective to which this HyperEdge belongs, the HyperEdge will be deleted and all HyperEdgeManager's DeleteListeners are notified this HyperEdge is deleted (see DeleteListener.objectDestroyed()).
  2. If gp!=null and gp is not the last GrapPerspective to which this HyperEdge belongs, all HyperEdgeManager's ChangeListeners are notified by invoking each listener's objectChanged() method with an EventNote of type HYPEREDGE, sub-type=REMOVED and a supporting information object being gp.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this HyperEdge has been deleted.
See Also:
destroy()

inGraphPerspective

boolean inGraphPerspective(giny.model.GraphPerspective gp)
Is this HyperEdge a member of a given GraphPerspective?

Parameters:
gp - the GraphPerspective in question.
Returns:
true iff HyperEdge is a member of gp.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if gp == null.

getAllEdgeTypes

java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> getAllEdgeTypes(giny.model.GraphPerspective gp)
Return a read-only Iterator (doesn't allow modification) of the distinct String interaction types of the Edges contained by this HyperEdge for a given GraphPerspective.

Parameters:
gp - the GraphPerspective in which to obtain the Edges from which to determine interaction types. If null, all Edges of the HyperEdge are used to determine interaction types. If this HyperEdge is not a member of gp, then an empty Iterator is returned.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this HyperEdge has been deleted.

getNumNodes

int getNumNodes(giny.model.GraphPerspective gp)
Return the number of distinct Nodes contained in this HyperEdge within the given GraphPerspective. For homodimer-like structures, the number of Nodes may not equal the number of Edges.

Parameters:
gp - the GraphPerspective in which to obtain the number of nodes for this HyperEdge. If null, the full number of Nodes is returned without regard to GraphPerspective. If this HyperEdge is not a member of gp, then 0 is returned.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this HyperEdge has been deleted.

Parameters:
gp - the GraphPerspective in which to obtain the number of edges for this HyperEdge. If null, the full number of Edges is returned without regard to GraphPerspective. If this HyperEdge is not a member of gp, then 0 is returned.

getNodes

java.util.Iterator<giny.model.Node> getNodes(java.lang.String edgeIType,
                                             giny.model.GraphPerspective gp)
Return all Nodes connected to an Edge of a given interaction type (e.g., EdgeTypeMap.SUBSTRATE) within a given GraphPerspective or return all Nodes within this HyperEdge if the given interaction type is null.

Parameters:
edgeIType - the interaction type of the Edges that connect to the Nodes of interest.
gp - the GraphPerspective from which to obtain Nodes. If null, all Nodes within the HyperEdge are considered without regard to GraphPerspective.
Returns:
a non-null, read-only Iterator (doesn't allow modification) over all distinct Nodes associated with an Edge whose interaction type is edgeIType and belongs to gp. If edgeIType is null, all distinct Nodes belonging to gp and this HyperEdge are returned. The Iterator will be empty if there are no Nodes associated with an Edge whose type is edgeIType, or if this HyperEdge is not a member of gp.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this HyperEdge has been deleted.

getNodesByEdgeTypes

java.util.Iterator<giny.model.Node> getNodesByEdgeTypes(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> edgeITypes,
                                                        giny.model.GraphPerspective gp)
Return all Nodes connected to Edges whose interaction type is one of a given Collection of types (e.g., ACTIVATING_MEDIATOR or INHIBITING_MEDIATOR) within a given GraphPerspective or return all Nodes within this HyperEdge if the given Collection is null.

Parameters:
edgeITypes - a Collection of the interaction types of the Edges that connect to the Nodes of interest.
gp - the GraphPerspective from which to obtain Nodes. If null, all Nodes within the HyperEdge are considered without regard to GraphPerspective.
Returns:
a non-null, read-only Iterator (doesn't allow modification) over all distinct Nodes associated with an Edge whose interaction type is a member of edgeITypes and belongs to gp. If edgeITypes is null, all distinct Nodes belonging to this HyperEdge are returned. The Iterator will be empty if there are no Nodes associated with an Edge whose type is a member of edgeITypes, or if this HyperEdge is not a member of gp.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this HyperEdge has been deleted.

getEdges

java.util.Iterator<giny.model.Edge> getEdges(giny.model.Node node,
                                             giny.model.GraphPerspective gp)
Returns all Edges associated with a given Node within a given GraphPerspective or returns all Edges within this HyperEdge within a given GraphPerspective if the given Node is null.

Parameters:
gp - the GraphPerspective from which to obtain Edges. If null, all Edges within the HyperEdge are considered without regard to GraphPerspective.
Returns:
a non-null, read-only Iterator (doesn't allow modification) over all Edges associated with node within gp. If node is null, all Edges belonging to this HyperEdge are returned within gp. The Iterator will be empty if there are are no Edges associated with node in this HyperEdge for the given gp.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this HyperEdge has been deleted.

Returns:
an arbitrary associated Edge to node. Will return null if node is null or is not associated with any node in this HyperEdge for the given gp.

boolean hasEdgeOfType(java.lang.String edgeIType,
                      giny.model.GraphPerspective gp)

gp - the GraphPerspective from which to check Edge containment. If null, all Edges within the HyperEdge are considered without regard to GraphPerspective.
Returns:
true iff this HyperEdge contains an edge whose interaction type equals edgeIType and the Edge is a member of gp. If edgeIType is null, returns false.

removeNode

boolean removeNode(giny.model.Node node,
                   giny.model.GraphPerspective gp)
Remove all Edges associated with a given Node from this HyperEdge for a given GraphPerspective. This may cause this entire HyperEdge to be removed from the given GraphPerspective if the number of Edges falls below getMinimumNumberEdges. When the HyperEdge is removed, this is equivalent to performing removeFromGraphPerspective (gp). Note that if the given GraphPerspective is the only GraphPerspective for which this HyperEdge belongs, the entire HyperEdge may be deleted.

Based on the above situations, one of three event notifications may be fired:

  1. If removal of the Node leads to this HyperEdge being deleted, then before this HyperEdge is deleted, all HyperEdgeManger DeleteListeners are notified that this HyperEdge is being deleted (see DeleteListener.objectDestroyed()).
  2. If removal of the Node leads to this HyperEdge being removed from a GraphPerpsective, then before this HyperEdge is removed, all HyperEdgeManager ChangeListeners are notified by invoking each listener's objectChanged() method with an EventNote of type HYPEREDGE, sub-type=REMOVED and a supporting information object of gp (see ChangeListener.objectChanged()).
  3. If removal of the Node does not lead to this HyperEdge being deleted or removed, then before each Edge is removed, all HyperEdgeManager ChangeListeners are notified by invoking each listener's objectChanged() method with an EventNote of type EDGE, sub-type=REMOVED and a supporting information object being a 2-element List whose first element will be the edge and whose second element will be gp (see ChangeListener.objectChanged()). Note that multiple objectChanged() notifications may take place--one for each Edge associated with node.

Parameters:
node - the Node to remove.
gp - the GraphPerspective in which to remove node. If null, then node is removed from all GraphPerspectives for which it belongs. Note that this may cause combinations of removal event notifications including removing a HyperEdge from a GraphPerspective and removal of edges from a GraphPerpsective.
Returns:
true if the node was removed, false if the node is not found, or is null.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this HyperEdge has been deleted.
See Also:
removeFromGraphPerspective(giny.model.GraphPerspective)

removeEdge

boolean removeEdge(giny.model.Edge edge,
                   giny.model.GraphPerspective gp)
Remove the given Edge from this HyperEdge for the given GraphPerspective. If the Node associated with this Edge is not connected to any other Edges, then this Node will be removed from this HyperEdge for the given GraphPerspective. Removal of this Edge will cause this entire HyperEdge to be removed from the given GraphPerspective if the number of Edges falls below getMinimumNumberEdges. When the HyperEdge is removed, this is equivalent to performing removeFromGraphPerspective (gp). Note that if the given GraphPerspective is the only GraphPerspective for which this HyperEdge belongs, the entire HyperEdge may be deleted.

Based on the above situations, one of three event notifications may be fired:

  1. If removal of the Edge leads to this HyperEdge being deleted then before this HyperEdge is deleted, all HyperEdgeManger DeleteListeners are notified that this HyperEdge is being deleted (see DeleteListener.objectDestroyed()).
  2. If removal of the Edge leads to this HyperEdge being removed from a GraphPerpsective, then before this HyperEdge is removed, all HyperEdgeManager ChangeListeners are notified by invoking each listener's objectChanged() method with an EventNote of type HYPEREDGE, sub-type=REMOVED and a supporting information object of gp (see ChangeListener.objectChanged()).
  3. If removal of the Edge does not lead to this HyperEdge being deleted or removed, then before this this Edge is removed, all HyperEdgeManager ChangeListeners are notified by invoking each listener's objectChanged() method with an EventNote of type EDGE, sub-type=REMOVED and a supporting information object being a 2-element List whose first element will be the edge and whose second element will be gp (see ChangeListener.objectChanged()).

Parameters:
edge - the Edge to remove.
gp - the GraphPerspective for which to remove edge. If null, then edge is removed from all GraphPerspectives for which it belongs. Note that this may cause combinations of removal event notifications including removing a HyperEdge from a GraphPerspective and removal of the edge from a GraphPerpsective.
Returns:
true if the edge was removed, false if edge is null or is not a member of this HyperEdge.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this HyperEdge has been deleted.
See Also:
removeFromGraphPerspective(giny.model.GraphPerspective)

addEdge

giny.model.Edge addEdge(giny.model.Node node,
                        java.lang.String edgeIType,
                        giny.model.GraphPerspective gp)
Add a new Edge connecting a given Node to this HyperEdge within a given GraphPerspective.

Under the appropriate conditions (see ChangeListener.objectChanged()) and after the Edge is added, all of the HyperEdgeManager's ChangeListeners are notified by invoking their objectChanged() method with an EventNote of type EDGE, sub-type=ADDED and a supporting information object being a 2-element List whose first element will be the new Edge and whose second element will be the GrapPerspective.

Parameters:
node - the Node for which to add a new Edge. If node is not a member of this HyperEdge, it will be added. If node is already a member of this HyperEdge, it will now have more than one Edge associated with it.
edgeIType - the interaction type of the Edge to create. edgeIType also determines the Role played by the node within the newly created Edge. This is done by using edgeIType as a key in the EdgeTypeMap to determine the EdgeRole associated with that edgeIType. If the value associated with the edgeIType key is EdgeRole.SOURCE, then node will be the source of the newly created Edge. If the value associated with the edgeIType key is EdgeRole.TARGET, then node will be the target of the newly created Edge. If edgeIType is not the key for any EdgeRole in the EdgeTypeMap, then node is used as the source of the newly created Edge.
gp - the GraphPerspective to which the new Edge and the node are to belong. If null, the new Edge and the node are added to all GraphPerspectives for which this HyperEdge belongs.
Returns:
the newly created Edge that was added to gp. null if node or edgeIType are null or if this HyperEdge doesn't belong to gp (when non-null).
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if node is a ConnectorNode of another HyperEdge.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this HyperEdge has been deleted.

connectHyperEdges

giny.model.Edge connectHyperEdges(giny.model.Node otherHEConnectorNode,
                                  java.lang.String fromEdgeIType,
                                  java.lang.String toEdgeIType)
Connect this HyperEdge to another. Adds an Edge that is shared in between two HyperEdge ConnectorNodes.

Parameters:
otherHEConnectorNode - the ConnectorNode of the other HyperEdge to connect to. Must be in the same GraphPerspective as this HyperEdge.
fromEdgeIType - the interaction type of the Edge within this HyperEdge.
toEdgeIType - the interaction type of the Edge within the HyperEdge representd by otherHEConnectorNode.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if otherHEConnectorNode is the ConnectorNode for this HyperEdge, if otherHEConnectorNode is not a ConnectorNode of a HyperEdge in the same GraphPerspective in which this HyperEdge resides, or if fromEdgeIType or toEdgeIType are null.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this HyperEdge has been deleted.

isConnected

boolean isConnected(giny.model.Node node1,
                    giny.model.Node node2,
                    giny.model.GraphPerspective gp)
Are the given Nodes members of this HyperEdge within the given GraphPerspective?

Parameters:
gp - the GraphPerspective for which node1 and node2 must belong. If null, node1 and node2 must belong to this HyperEdge without regard to GraphPerspective.
Returns:
true iff both node1 and node2 belong to this HyperEdge within gp. Or, simply belong to this HyperEdge, if gp==null.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this HyperEdge has been deleted.

getGraphPerspectives

java.util.Iterator<giny.model.GraphPerspective> getGraphPerspectives()
Return all the GraphPerspectives this HyperEdge belongs to.

Returns:
a non-null, read-only Iterator (doesn't allow modification) over all GraphPerspectives to which this HyperEdge belongs.

destroy

void destroy()
Remove this HyperEdge. All Edges belonging to this HyperEdge will be removed from the RootGraph. The ConnectorNode of this HyperEdge will also be removed. All automatically generated attributes of the Connector Node and all Edges are also removed. The LifeState of this HyperEdge is set to DELETED and any future attempts to perform operations on this object will throw IllegalStateExceptions.

Before this HyperEdge is deleted, DeleteListener.objectDestroyed() methods are invoked to notify interested listeners that this object is being destroyed.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this HyperEdge has been deleted.

getState

LifeState getState()
The state of this object as defined by LifeState (e.g., LifeState.NORMAL).

boolean isState(LifeState ls)
Is this object in a given LifeState?

Returns:
true iff this object is in state ls.

Set the name of this object.

Under the appropriate conditions (see ChangeListener.objectChanged()) and after the name has been changed, all of this object's ChangeListeners are notified by invoking their objectChanged() method with an EventNote of type NAME, sub-type=CHANGED and a supporting information object the previous name.

Parameters:
new_name - the new String name of this object.
Returns:
the previous name of the object.

Returns:

setDirected

boolean setDirected(boolean new_state)
Set the directedness of this HyperEdge.

Under the appropriate conditions (see ChangeListener.objectChanged()) and after the directedness has been changed, all of this object's ChangeListeners are notified by invoking their objectChanged() method with an EventNote of type DIRECTED, sub-type=CHANGED and a supporting information object=null.

Returns:
the last value of directedness.
Throws:
